history.content: Beginning this Monday at ~ 9am, the upper div waitlists have been processed sequentially without regard to major status.  That doesn't change campus barriers around blocking enrollment when schedule conflicts exist.

What is the policy regarding people being moved from waitlist to enrolled for upper div CS courses? I was in waitlist position 68 for CS 170 and the class had 186 open seats (due to the 70% enrollment policy) and now 184 people got moved from the waitlist to being enrolled, and yet I'm still on the waitlist, in position 8. Why was I not enrolled? I thought it's been established that the waitlist is processed sequentially. 


I'm declared LSCS btw.


EDIT: Thanks for the answer. Made me realize I had schedule conflicts with a class I was planning to drop.
history.subject: How does upper-div waitlist work
